name: src/behaviour/Behaviour.js
Behaviour
description:
The base behaviour class.
Behaviours manage a particle's behaviour after they have been emitted.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Behaviour instance.

name: id
description: The behaviour's id

name: life
description: The life of the behaviour

name: easing
description: The behaviour's decaying trend

name: age
description: The age of the behaviour

name: energy
description: The energy of the behaviour

name: dead
description: Determines if the behaviour is dead or not

name: name
description: The behaviour name;

name: reset
description: Reset this behaviour's parameters

name: normalizeForce
description: Normalize a force by 1:100;

name: normalizeValue
description: Normalize a value by 1:100;

name: initialize
description: Set the behaviour's initial properties on the particle.

name: applyBehaviour
description:
Compares the age of the behaviour vs integration time and determines
if the behaviour should be set to dead or not.
Sets the behaviour energy as a factor of particle age and life.

TODO It's a little weird that sub class behaviours override this method and
also call it from within their own applyBehaviour method. Since this method
primarily sets energy, consider renaming it to setEnergy or energise. Then
each sub class can simply call this.setEnergy instead of super.applyBehaviour.

params.name: particle
params.description: The particle to apply the behaviour to

name: destroy
description: Destory this behaviour.

name: fromJSON
description: Returns a new instance of the behaviour from the JSON object passed.

params.name: json
params.description: JSON object containing the required constructor properties

name: _setRotation
description:
Sets the particle's rotation prior to the behaviour being applied.

NOTE It's hard to see here, but this is mutating the particle's rotation
even though the particle is not being passed in directly.

NOTE the else if below will never be reached because the value being passed in
will never be of type Vector3D.

params.name: value
params.description:
the value to set the rotation value to, if 'random'
rotation is randomised

name: src/core/Particle.js
Particle
description: A Particle is an object that is emitted by an emitter.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Particle instance.

params.name: properties
params.description: The properties to instantiate the particle with

properties.name: properties.dead
properties.description: Determines if the particle is dead or not

properties.name: properties.sleep
properties.description: Determines if the particle is sleeping or not

name: id
description: The particle's unique id

name: life
description: The particle's life

name: age
description: The particle's age

name: energy
description: The particle's energy loss

name: dead
description: Determines if the particle is dead or not

name: sleep
description: Determines if the particle is sleeping or not

name: body
description: The particle's body

name: parent
description: The particle's parent

name: mass
description: The particle's mass

name: radius
description: The particle's radius

name: alpha
description: The particle's alpha

name: scale
description: The particle's scale

name: useColor
description: Determines whether to use color or not

name: useAlpha
description: Determines whether to use alpha or not

name: easing
description: The particle's easing

name: p
description: The particle's position

name: v
description: The particle's velocity

name: a
description: The particle's acceleration

name: old
description: The particle's last position, velocity and acceleration

name: behaviours
description: The particle's behaviours array

name: transform
description: The particle's transform collection

name: color
description: The particle's color store

name: rotation
description: The particle's rotation

name: getDirection
description: Gets the particle's current direction.

name: reset
description:
Resets the particle's default properties and clear's its particle's position,
velocity, acceleration, color and rotation. Also destroy's the particle's
transform collection & removes all behaviours.

name: update
description:
Updates the particle's properties by applying each behaviour to the particle.
Will also update the particle's energy, unless it's age is greater than it's life
in which case it will be destroyed.

name: addBehaviour
description: Adds a behaviour to the particle.

params.name: behaviour
params.description: The behaviour to add to the particle

name: addBehaviours
description: Adds multiple behaviours to the particle.

params.name: behaviours
params.description: An array of behaviours to add to the particle

name: removeBehaviour
description: Removes the behaviour from the particle.

params.name: behaviour
params.description: The behaviour to remove from the particle

name: removeAllBehaviours
description: Removes all behaviours from the particle.

name: destroy
description: Destroys the particle.

name: src/core/Pool.js
Pool
description:
An object pool implementation. Used for pooling objects to avoid unnecessary
garbage collection.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Pool instance.

name: cID
description: Incrementing id that keeps a count of the number of objects created

name: list
description: Map of pools in the format of PUID<String>: pool<Array>

name: create
description:
Attempts to create a new object either by creating a new instance or calling its
clone method.

NOTE If unable to create an object this method will simply return undefined
it should possibly throw an error in this case.

params.name: functionOrObject
params.description: The object to instantiate or clone

name: canInstantiateObject
description: Determines if the object is able to be instantiated or not.

name: canCloneObject
description: Determines if the object is able to be cloned or not.

name: canCreateNewObject
description: Determines if a new object is able to be created.

name: getCount
description: Gets a count of all objects in the pool.

name: get
description: Gets an object either by creating a new one or retrieving it from the pool.

params.name: obj
params.description: The function or object to get

name: expire
description: Pushes an object into the pool.

name: destroy
description: Destroys all pools.

name: _getList
description: Gets the pool mapped to the UID.

name: src/core/Proton.js
Proton
description:
The core of the three-proton particle engine.
A Proton instance can contain multiple emitters, each with their own initializers
and behaviours.

name: constructor
description:
Constructs a Proton instance.

TODO the proton instance should have an integrator set as a property.
It is only required from the emitter class, and therefore can be accessed within
that class from emitter.parent.integrator

params.name: preParticles
params.description: The number of particles to start with

name: preParticles
description: The number of particles to start with

name: integrationType
description: The integration type to use

name: emitters
description: The emitters in the particle system

name: renderers
description: The renderers for the system

name: pool
description: A pool used to manage the internal proton cache of objects

name: eventDispatcher
description: Internal event dispatcher

name: integrator
description: Returns a new Integration instance based on the type passed to the constructor.

name: fromJSON
description: Creates a Proton instance from a JSON object.

params.name: json
params.description: The JSON to create the Proton instance from

params.name: json.emitters
params.description: The emitters for the proton instance

name: dispatch
description: Proxy method for the internal event dispatcher's dispatchEvent method.

name: addRenderer
description: Adds a renderer to the Proton instance and initializes it.

name: removeRenderer
description: Removes a renderer from the Proton instance.

name: addEmitter
description:
Adds an emitter to the Proton instance.
Dispatches the EMITTER_ADDED event.

name: removeEmitter
description:
Removes an emitter from the Proton instance.
Dispatches the EMITTER_REMOVED event.

name: update
description: Updates the particle system based on the delta passed.

name: getCount
description: Gets a count of the total number of particles in the system.

name: destroy
description: Destroys all emitters and the Proton pool.

name: integrator
description: The system's integrator

log

You can use this emit particles.

use like this log('+12',mc); log 12 times

ease
description: The Ease class provides a collection of easing functions for use with Proton

name: src/emitter/BehaviourEmitter.js
constructor
description:
The BehaviourEmitter class inherits from Proton.Emitter

use the BehaviourEmitter you can add behaviours to self;

name: addSelfBehaviour

add the Behaviour to emitter;

you can use Behaviours array:emitter.addSelfBehaviour(Behaviour1,Behaviour2,Behaviour3);

name: removeSelfBehaviour
description: remove the Behaviour for self

name: src/emitter/Emitter.js
Emitter
description:
Emitters are the Proton engine's particle factories. They cause particles to
be rendered by emitting them, and store all particle initializers and behaviours.

name: constructor
description: Constructs an Emitter instance.

params.name: properties
params.description: The properties to instantiate the particle with

name: particles
description: The particles emitted by this emitter.

name: initializers
description: The initializers for particles emitted by this emitter.

name: behaviours
description: The behaviours for particles emitted by this emitter.

name: currentEmitTime
description: The current emit iteration.

name: totalEmitTimes
description: The total number of times the emitter should emit particles.

name: damping
description: The friction coefficient for all particle to emit by.

name: bindEmitter
description:
Ensures that particles emitted by this emitter are positioned
according to the emitter's properties.

name: bindEmitterEvent
description:
Determines if the emitter will dispatch internal events. Defaults
to false

name: rate
description: The number of particles to emit per second (a [particle]/b [s])

name: id
description: The emitter's id.

name: eventDispatcher
description: The emitter's internal event dispatcher.

name: dispatch
description: Proxy method for the internal event dispatcher's dispatchEvent method.

name: setRate
description: Sets the emitter rate.

name: setPosition
description: Sets the position of the emitter.

params.name: position
params.description: an object containing x, y and z props

name: emit
description:
Sets the total number of times the emitter should emit particles as well as
the emitter's life. Also intializes the emitter rate.
This enables the emitter to emit particles.

TODO Refactor this so that it does not accept mixed type arguments.

params.name: totalEmitTimes
params.description: the total number of times to emit particles

params.name: life
params.description: the life of this emitter in milliseconds

name: stopEmit
description: Stops the emitter from emitting particles.

name: removeAllParticles
description:
Kills all of the emitter's particles.

TODO Rename this method to killAllParticles

name: addInitializer
description:
Adds a particle initializer to the emitter.
Each initializer is run on each particle when they are created.

name: addInitializers
description: Adds multiple particle initializers to the emitter.

name: setInitializers
description: Sets the emitter's particle initializers.

name: removeInitializer
description: Removes an initializer from the emitter's initializers array.

name: removeAllInitializers
description: Removes all initializers.

name: addBehaviour
description:
Adds a behaviour to the emitter. All emitter behaviours are added to each particle when
they are emitted.

params.name: behaviour
params.description: The behaviour to add to the emitter

name: addBehaviours
description: Adds multiple behaviours to the emitter.

name: setBehaviours
description: Sets the emitter's behaviours.

name: removeBehaviour
description: Removes the behaviour from the emitter's behaviours array.

name: removeAllBehaviours
description: Removes all behaviours from the emitter.

name: createParticle
description:
Creates a particle by retreiving one from the pool and setting it up with
the supplied initializer and behaviour.

TODO This method is only ever called from generate and never with arguments
so it's safe to remove the arguments.

name: setupParticle
description:
Sets up a particle by running all initializers on it and setting its behaviours.
Also adds the particle to this.particles.

TODO This method is only ever called from createParticle and never with arguments
so it's safe to remove the arguments.

name: update
description:
Updates the emitter according to the time passed by calling the generate
and integrate methods. The generate method creates particles, the integrate
method updates existing particles.

If the emitter age is greater than time, the emitter is killed.

name: integrate
description:
Runs the integration algorithm on the emitter and all particles.
Updates the particles with the timstamp passed.

name: generate
description: Generates new particles.

name: destroy
description: Kills the emitter.

name: src/emitter/FollowEmitter.js
constructor
description:
The FollowEmitter class inherits from Proton.Emitter

use the FollowEmitter will emit particle when mousemoving

name: emit
description: start emit particle

name: stopEmit
description: stop emiting

name: destroy
description: Destory this Emitter

name: src/initializer/Rate.js
Rate
description:
Calculates the rate of particle emission.

TODO This doesn't need to be an initializer, it doesn't have an initialize
method, it overrides the base init method and it is only relevent to the Emitter class.
It would be better to move this to the Emitter module itself as a standalone class.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a Rate instance.

params.name: numPan
params.description: The number of particles to emit

params.name: timePan
params.description: The time between each particle emission

name: numPan
description: Sets the number of particles to emit.

name: timePan
description: Sets the time between each particle emission.

name: startTime
description: The rate's start time.

name: nextTime
description: The rate's next time.

name: init
description: Sets the startTime and nextTime properties.

name: getValue
description: Gets the number of particles to emit.

name: fromJSON
description: Creates a Rate initializer from JSON.

params.name: json
params.description: The JSON to construct the instance from.

properties.name: json.particlesMin
properties.description: The minimum number of particles to emit

properties.name: json.particlesMax
properties.description: The maximum number of particles to emit

properties.name: json.perSecondMin

name: src/zone/Zone.js
Zone
description:
A Zone determines the area in 3D space where an emitter's particles can position
themselves. They are supplied to both the Position initializer
and the CrossZone behaviour.

name: isBoxZone
description: Determines if this zone is a BoxZone.

name: isLineZone
description: Determines if this zone is a LineZone.

name: isMeshZone
description: Determines if this zone is a MeshZone.

name: isPointZone
description: Determines if this zone is a PointZone.

name: isScreenZone
description: Determines if this zone is a ScreenZone.

name: isSphereZone
description: Determines if this zone is a SphereZone.

name: _dead
description: Sets the particle's dead property to true if required.

name: src/zone/index.js

content:
# three-proton

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/rohan-deshpande/three-proton.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/rohan-deshpande/three-proton)
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/repos/github/rohan-deshpande/three-proton/badge.svg?branch=master)](https://coveralls.io/github/rohan-deshpande/three-proton?branch=master&kill_cache=1)

**Three Proton** is a magical, WebGL based 3D particle engine that has been designed to work in concert with [`three.js`](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js). It is based on the [Proton](https://github.com/a-jie/Proton) particle engine library and shares much of its API.

Check out the examples and API reference documentation at [https://rohan-deshpande.github.io/three-proton/](https://rohan-deshpande.github.io/three-proton/)

## Features

- Four kinds of renderers
  - `MeshRenderer`
  - `SpriteRenderer`
  - `PointsRenderer`
  - `CustomRenderer`
- Three kinds of emitters which can simulate many different physical effects

  - `Emitter`
  - `BehaviourEmitter`
  - `FollowEmitter`

- Many kinds of particle behaviours and initializers
- Perfect compatibility with [`three@0.98.0`](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js).

## Installation

### npm

```
npm i --save @rohandeshpande/three-proton
```

### script

```
<script type='text/javascript' src='node_modules/three-proton/build/three-proton.js'></script>
```

## Commands

- `build` - Builds the module and writes the code into `./build/three-proton.js`
- `docs` - Serves the docs at http://localhost:8080
- `docs:build` - Copies the latest build to `./docs/js` and builds the API reference docs
- `test` - Runs all specs
- `test:only <spec>` - Runs a specific spec
- `test:watch` - Watches tests
- `test:watch-only <spec>` - Watches a specific spec
- `lint` - Lints code and circular dependencies in `./src`
- `coverage:generate` - Generates a code coverage report
- `coverage:view` - View the code coverage report
- `coverage:publish` - Publishes the coverage report
- `git:publish <commit-message>` - Builds the module, adds all changed files commits with the message you supply and pushes to remote

## Usage

### Module

```javascript
import Proton, {
  Emitter,
  Rate,
  Span,
  Position,
  Mass,
  Radius,
  Life,
  Velocity,
  PointZone,
  Vector3D,
  Alpha,
  Scale,
  Color
} from '@rohandeshpande/three-proton';
import * as THREE from 'three';

const proton = new Proton();
const emitter = new Emitter();
const renderer = new SpriteRenderer(threeScene);

// Set emitter rate (particles per second), particle initializers and behaviours
emitter
  .setRate(new Rate(new Span(4, 16), new Span(0.01)))
  .setInitializers([
    new Position(new PointZone(0, 0)),
    new Mass(1),
    new Radius(6, 12),
    new Life(3),
    new Velocity(45, new Vector3D(0, 1, 0), 180)
  ])
  .setBehaviours([
    new Alpha(1, 0),
    new Scale(0.1, 1.3),
    new Color(new THREE.Color(), new THREE.Color())
  ]);

// add the emitter and a renderer to proton
proton.addEmitter(emitter.emit()).addRenderer(renderer);
```

### Script

If you are adding `three-proton` to your project in the script tag, the only difference to the above example is how you access the classes you need. You can do that like so

```javascript
const { Proton, Emitter, Rate, Span } = window.Proton;
const proton = new Proton();
```

## License

[MIT](LICENSE.md)
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@rohandeshpande/three-proton",
  "version": "1.0.13",
  "description": "A magical, WebGL based 3D particle engine",
  "main": "./build/three-proton.js",
  "directories": {
    "docs": "docs"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "build": "webpack --env build && npm run docs:build",
    "docs": "./scripts/docs",
    "docs:build": "cp ./build/three-proton.js docs/js && ./node_modules/.bin/esdoc",
    "test": "mocha --require babel-core/register --colors './test/**/*.spec.js'",
    "test:only": "mocha --require babel-core/register --colors",
    "test:watch": "mocha --require babel-core/register --colors -w './test/**/*.spec.js'",
    "test:watch-only": "mocha --require babel-core/register --colors -w ",
    "lint": "eslint src test && ./node_modules/.bin/madge --circular src",
    "coverage:view": "open ./coverage/lcov-report/index.html",
    "coverage:generate": "./node_modules/.bin/istanbul cover ./node_modules/.bin/_mocha './test/**/*.spec.js' -- --require babel-core/register",
    "coverage:publish": "./node_modules/.bin/istanbul-coveralls",
    "git:publish": "./scripts/publish"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/rohan-deshpande/three-proton.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "particle",
    "three.js",
    "3d"
  ],
  "authors": [
    "a-jie",
    "rohan-deshpande"
  ],
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/rohan-deshpande/three-proton/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/rohan-deshpande/three-proton#readme",
  "dependencies": {
    "lodash": "^4.17.11",
    "three": "^0.98.0",
    "uuid": "^3.3.2"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel": "^6.23.0",
    "babel-core": "^6.24.1",
    "babel-eslint": "^7.2.1",
    "babel-loader": "^6.4.1",
    "babel-plugin-add-module-exports": "^0.2.1",
    "babel-plugin-transform-decorators-legacy": "^1.3.4",
    "babel-plugin-transform-object-rest-spread": "^6.26.0",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.24.1",
    "chai": "^4.2.0",
    "domino": "^2.1.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^3.19.0",
    "eslint-loader": "^1.7.1",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.8.0",
    "http-server": "^0.11.1",
    "istanbul": "^1.1.0-alpha.1",
    "istanbul-coveralls": "^1.0.3",
    "jquery": "^3.3.1",
    "jsdoc": "~3.4.0",
    "madge": "^3.3.0",
    "minami": "~1.1.1",
    "mocha": "^5.2.0",
    "sinon": "^7.1.1",
    "stats.js": "^0.17.0",
    "webpack": "^2.3.3",
    "yargs": "^7.0.2"
  }
}
name: package.json
